name: Zubaida Tariq
awards: Masala TV Award for Best Cooking Expert
Lux Style Award for Best TV Chef

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.description: A classic Pakistani dish made with flavored rice and meat, often served with raita.
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the rice separately and then layer it with the cooked meat and spices. The dish is then cooked on low heat until the flavors meld together.

recipes.name: Nihari
recipes.description: A slow-cooked stew made with beef or lamb shanks and a flavorful spice blend.
recipes.cookingMethod: The meat is first simmered in water with the spices, then the stew is thickened with a flour-based paste. It is typically served with naan or roti.

recipes.name: Samosas
recipes.description: A popular snack made with crispy pastry and a savory filling.
recipes.cookingMethod: The pastry is rolled out and cut into triangles, then filled with a mixture of mashed potatoes, peas, and spices. The samosas are then deep-fried until golden brown.

description: Zubaida Tariq was a well-known Pakistani chef who was famous for her traditional cooking techniques and delicious recipes. She was a household name in Pakistan and had a huge fan following. Her cooking shows were very popular and she was known for her friendly and easy-to-follow style of teaching. She passed away in January 2018, but her legacy as a great Pakistani chef lives on.

name: Shireen Anwar
awards: Masala TV Award for Best Cooking Expert

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti with Meatballs
recipes.description: A classic Pakistani dish made with flavored rice and meat, often served with raita.
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, parsley, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, and egg. Shape the mixture into 1-inch balls.

recipes.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
recipes.description: A slow-cooked stew made with beef or lamb shanks and a flavorful spice blend.
recipes.cookingMethod: In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the quinoa and stir. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Remove from the heat and let stand for 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Samosas

recipes.cookingMethod: The pastry is rolled out and cut into triangles, then filled with a mixture of mashed potatoes, peas, and spices. The samosas are then deep-fried until golden brown.

description: Shireen Anwar is a popular Pakistani chef who is known for her unique recipes and cooking style. She has been a part of the Pakistani cooking industry for over 25 years and has won several awards for her expertise. She is a regular on cooking shows on Pakistani television and is known for her warm and friendly personality. Her recipes are loved by people all over the world and she is considered to be one of the best Pakistani chefs of all time.
